title: LangGraph for Beginners – Build Agentic Workflows Step-by-Step
description: A hands-on, beginner-friendly introduction to LangGraph – the powerful framework for creating stateful, multi-actor AI agents with cycles and branching logic. Learn how to build simple to advanced agent workflows (single agent, multi-agent, hierarchical) using visual nodes, state management, persistence, and human-in-the-loop patterns. Every lesson includes clear explanations, micro-exercises, ready-to-run Jupyter notebooks, and small projects.
target_audience: Beginners who know basic Python and want to build reliable, controllable AI agents that can plan, remember state, and loop until a task is complete.
learning_objectives: Understand graphs vs chains and when to use LangGraph
Create nodes, edges, and state schemas
Build single-agent, multi-agent, and supervisor workflows
Deploy a complete LangGraph agent as a web API

metadata.course_focus: Building stateful, cyclic AI agents with LangGraph
